intro: Triphelia, commonly known as the fairy lantern or ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, showy flowers that often resemble lanterns, hence their common name. Triphelia species are typically found in moist, acidic soils in temperate regions. They are low-growing shrubs or herbs with hairy stems and elliptical leaves. The flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn.
